intro: Dicliptera albocostata, commonly known as the white-striped grass, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves with distinct white longitudinal stripes. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that consist of spikelets with two to three florets. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Dicliptera albocostata is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage.
